result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Jordan Mcrae was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Daniel Jordan Mcrae is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Daniel Jordan Mcrae was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Daniel Jordan Mcrae was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

supervisions.notes:
- Sign up for Probation on 10/26/22 by 04:00PM
- Court may consider early release from Probation upon completion of requested programming 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

2:07 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Fox, Defendant Daniel Jordan Mcrae in court.  Attorney A.W. Schutte in court for Daniel Jordan Mcrae. Prosecuting Attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin. ADA Damrau recites resolution. Court questions Defendant. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands and pleads GUILTY to Count 2 Battery - WITH Domestic Abuse Enhancer and GUITY to count 3 - criminal damage. Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights. Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts. Court finds Defendant guilty. Upon motion of the State, Court dismisses counts 1 and 4.  Court orders: 
Count 2
S/W 2 year probation: 
- 4 months STAYED
- Court Costs: $243. Payable through probation
- DNA Surcharge: $200. Payable through probation
- Domestic abuse surcharge $100. Payable through probation

Count 3
I/S - 4 Months jail - I/S 2 year probation: 
- Court Costs: $243. Payable through probation
- DNA Surcharge: $200. Payable through probation
- $800 in restitution payable to victim 

Conditions of Probation:
- DNA Sample
- AODA within 30 Days and follow through with recommendations. 
- Psychological/psychiatric evaluation upon agent request. 
- Maintain Mental health counseling and treatment
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- Absolute sobriety and take prescribed medications only as prescribed.
- No abusive contact with D.M. 
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol - except in the course of employment. 
- Complete GED
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's 
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent and pay supervision fees
Sign up for probation by 4:00 today. 

Court to consider early release from probation upon completion of requested programming. 

Adjourned at 2:41 pm
Probation review hearing scheduled for January 26, 2023 at 04:00 pm.
Probation review hearing on January 26, 2023 at 04:00 pm.

09:56 AM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur. ADA:  Brian Thomas Smestad   DF ATTY:  A.W. Schutte   DF:  Daniel Jordan Mcrae appeared. Atty Schutte states DE would like to waive preliminary hearing. Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.   Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. NG. Waive speedy trial. Court sets STC via Zoom to allow time for Atty Schutte to decide on potential motions. Defendant confirms mailing address, but states he still doesn't have stable housingm and updates cell phone for text message reminders. Adjourned at 10:01 AM.  gll  Status conference scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 11:45 am.

Pretrial Assessment. arc    CONFIDENTIAL.
Status conference on May 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.

- Defendant allowed 1 time to residence to retreive personal belongings with law enforcement.


- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, D.M or residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
